meanings.definition: Having previously held a particular position or status.
meanings.sent1: The former teacher now works at the library.
meanings.sent2: My former school was much smaller than my current one.
meanings.sent3: The former student returned to visit his old classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her former life seemed like a distant memory.
meanings.sent5: The former champion graciously passed on the trophy to the new winner.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the first of two things mentioned.
meanings.sent1: The former option was more expensive but of higher quality.
meanings.sent2: I prefer the former design over the new one.
meanings.sent3: The former color of the car was a bright red.
meanings.sent4: The former chapter of the book was more exciting than the latter.
meanings.sent5: The former route was longer but more scenic.

meanings.definition: A person who previously held a particular position or status.
meanings.sent1: The former of the company was known for his innovative ideas.
meanings.sent2: The former of the school still visits to check on the students.
meanings.sent3: The former of the team surprised everyone by joining the competition.
meanings.sent4: The former of the group shared valuable insights during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The former of the department retired after many years of service.
